required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Decision Aid to Assist Low-Risk Nulliparous Women Considering Induction of Labor At 39 Weeks
clinical_study.official_title: Decision Aid to Assist Low-Risk Nulliparous Women Considering Induction of Labor At 39 Weeks: A Randomized Trial (DAWN Trial)

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to assess if the utilization of a decision-aid increases the likelihood of low-risk nulliparous women undergoing elective induction of labor at 39.0-39.6 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects who decided to undergo elective induction of labor at 39.0-39.6 weeks after utilization of a decision-aid
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects who decided to undergo elective induction of labor at 39.0-39.6 weeks after utilization of a decision-aid

secondary_outcome.description: Composite neonatal morbidity among (CNM) is any of the following: 1) Apgar score < 7 at 5 min, 2) umbilical arterial pH < 7.00, 3) intraventricular hemorrhage grade III or IV, 4) periventricular leukomalacia, 5) intubation for over 24 hrs, 6) necrotizing enterocolitis grade 2 or 3, 7) stillbirth or 8) death within 28 days of birth.
Number of subjects with morbidities as described by American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology (ACOG)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Shared decision-making with a patient decision-aid

intervention.description: A tablet computer-based decision-aid was developed by the study investigators based on the standards of the International Patient Decision Aid Standards Collaboration9
intervention.arm_group_label: Shared decision-making with a patient decision-aid

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Low-risk nulliparous women- no previous pregnancy > 23 weeks
- 18-50 years of age
- Singleton gestation
- Between 34.0 and 36.6 weeks at the time of screening. Randomization must occur between 37.0-37.6 weeks inclusive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. First sonographic examination after 20 weeks 2. Women with any of the following comorbidities (at the time of randomization):
1. Autoimmune disorders (antiphospholipid antibody, lupus, rheumatoid arthritis, scleroderma)
2. Cerclage in the index pregnancy
3. Diabetes mellitus-gestational or pre-gestational
4. Hematologic disorders (coagulation defects, sickle cell disease, thrombocytopenia, thrombophilia)
5. Hypertension (chronic or pregnancy induced) before enrollment
6. HIV (human immunodeficiency virus)
7. Institutionalized individuals (prisoners)
8. Prior obstetric history of: 1) intrauterine growth restriction, 2) preterm birth before 34 weeks, 3) severe preeclampsia, eclampsia, HELLP syndrome, and 4) stillbirth after 24 weeks or neonatal death
9. Preterm labor or ruptured membranes before enrollment
10. Psychiatric disorder (bipolar, depression) on medication
11. Placenta previa / 3rd trimester bleeding
12. Renal insufficiency (serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dL)
13. Restrictive lung disease
14. Fetal red blood cell isoimmunization
15. Seizure disorder on medication
16. Thyroid disease on medication
17. Body Mass Index (BMI) above 40 kg/m 3. Major fetal Anomaly including: anencephaly, spina bifida, bilateral renal agenesis, cystic hygroma with hydrops, diaphragmatic hernia, or congenital heart defects 4. Unable to understand consent in English or Spanish

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
